emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Full Stack Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously design, develop, test, and deploy complete software solutions based on user requirements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error, speeds up development cycles, but raises concerns about job displacement in software development.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will depend on trust in AI accuracy, regulatory acceptance, and integration with existing development tools.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Cryptography
emerging_technologies.description: Development of cryptographic systems robust against quantum computing attacks, integrating into blockchain and other secure systems.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances security in digital transactions, protecting sensitive data against future threats.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be driven by the need for future-proof security measures as quantum computing becomes more prevalent.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Drone Networks
emerging_technologies.description: A network of drones capable of self-coordinating for tasks like delivery, surveillance, or disaster response.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Improves efficiency in logistics, emergency response times, but poses challenges in privacy and airspace management.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, public acceptance, and technological reliability will drive adoption.

emerging_technologies.name: Brain-Computer Interface for Learning
emerging_technologies.description: BCI systems that enhance learning speed by directly interfacing with cognitive processes.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize education but raises ethical questions about cognitive inequality and privacy.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption would be influenced by ethical considerations, technological maturity, and societal readiness.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Personal Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: Advanced AI assistants capable of handling complex tasks like scheduling, information retrieval, and personal finance management.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in personal and professional environments, integrated into daily life.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Grid Technology
mainstream_technologies.description: Integrated systems for managing electricity distribution more efficiently with AI-driven demand-response.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in urban areas, driven by energy efficiency and sustainability goals.

epoch_themes.description: AI not only assists but augments human capabilities in decision-making, creativity, and productivity.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for significant productivity gains, but also raises concerns about dependency on AI.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on AI ethics, regulation, and AI-human collaboration.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies that drive towards sustainability, reducing environmental impact and enhancing energy efficiency.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes a greener lifestyle, but requires global cooperation and changes in consumer behavior.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Move towards circular economies, increased investment in green tech, and policy incentives for sustainable practices.
